Let $ABC$ and $A'B'C'$ be two triangles in the same plane with side lengths $a,b,c$ resp. $a',b',c'$ and areas $S,S'$. Then \[a'^2(b^2+c^2-a^2)+b'^2(c^2+a^2-b^2)+c'^2(a^2+b^2-c^2) \geq 16 S\cdot S'\] Moreover, the equality holds only for similar triangles.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
